posts.cooked:
I find the new reaction feature awesome :) We keep using it all the time with my friends and family. And our use of it is getting sophisticated.

I often need to combine several emojis together to express various different reactions. This is already featured by e.g. Discord and it does (combinatorially) increase the semantic space of reactions much! Actually, the possibilities explode.

For instance, instead of hesitating between and , I‚Äôd just go for . Instead of hesitating between and , I‚Äôd go for ‚Ä¶

This also enables all sorts of sweet concepts combinations that produce semantics, e.g.:

Does this happen all the time or am I just lucky?
‚Üí

Check out my new essay online.
‚Üí

Does anyone need anything?
‚Üí

I have left your door open so your cat can get in and out.
‚Üí

I‚Äôve been ranked 5th / 118 candidates.
‚Üí

Is it true that you speak Greek?
‚Üí

Where are you? Are you okay?
‚Üí

I understand that unlimited reactions cannot be supported. But I‚Äôm sure that a reasonable limit like 10 or 256 or even 1024 will hardly be ever reached in practice.

Note that repetition matters, like in

Why are you so long?
‚Üí

And obviously, order, e.g.:

Sigh, I‚Äôve failed that again, will I ever succeed?
‚Üí

Obviously, there is no universal meaning of emoji combinations (yet), but it‚Äôs easy to pick up some, create and drop meanings with families and friends, so I‚Äôm sure it would be a delightful feature. What do you think? :)

posts.name: Para Sympathikus
posts.cooked:
hey @iago-lito

welcome to the Signal community

just to get some things right:

what you request is not the ability to make multiple single reactions for the same message
but to combine multiple reactions to one reaction?

I guess, from a GUI point of perspective, this could get quite complicated

for example, how do you want to sort it, if there are more people choosing the same symbols for ‚Äúmulti reaction‚Äù, but with different colours

should thumb up + green heart be counted as same reaction as thumb up + red heart, or should they be seperated‚Ä¶

do you know how Discord does this, as you brought it up as example?

as this would also need to be included on every platform, and not just android,
perhaps you can remove the Android feature request tag, so it is a general feature request

Hey @ParaSym , thank you for reply, sorry I‚Äôve been straight to my point without saying hello. I‚Äôm glad to have found this welcoming place :)

I‚Äôm not sure I understand the distinction you make between ‚Äúmake multiple single reactions‚Äù and ‚Äúcombine multiple reactions to one reaction‚Äù‚Ä¶ here is what it makes me think of:

Take for instance the timeline:

Alice (message): I‚Äôve been ranked 5th / 118 candidates.
Bob (reaction):
Bob (reaction):
Carl (reaction):
Carl (reaction):
Carl (reaction):

Now, here is what I understand:

  1. ‚Äúmake multiple single reactions‚Äù would display:

Alice: I‚Äôve been ranked 5th / 118 candidates.
reactions:
[hover information: (Bob, Bob, Carl, Carl, Carl)]

  1. ‚Äúcombine multiple reactions to one reaction‚Äù would display

Alice: I‚Äôve been ranked 5th / 118 candidates.
combined reactions (Bob):
combined reactions (Carl):

  1. In Discord style (since you asked), the emojis cumulate with a count so they cannot be duplicated, and the order corresponds to the order of first apparition for each emoji. So the above timeline would result in:

Alice: I‚Äôve been ranked 5th / 118 candidates.
reactions: 2
[hover information: (Bob, Bob and Carl, Carl, Carl)]

What I think of these 3 designs:

  1. Looks cool. It seems close to what‚Äôs already existing. One problem for Carl would be to be that it‚Äôs not possible to add up their voice to Bob‚Äôs symbol, but I think it‚Äôs a simple design to let Carl choose instead:
  • Either they pick a new emoji which adds up to the sequence (no problem if it happens to be a duplicate symbol).
  • Or they click on Bob‚Äôs symbol to bump its count to 2.
  • Or they do both. In this case, we end up with:

Alice: I‚Äôve been ranked 5th / 118 candidates.
reactions: 2
[hover information: (Bob, Bob and Carl, Carl, Carl, Carl)]

  1. Looks like complicated new GUI features. And ultimately useless, as it just reproduces what would (more) simply happen in this case;

Alice: I‚Äôve been ranked 5th / 118 candidates.
Bob (regular message):
Carl (regular message):

So I don‚Äôt think that 2. is worth it.

  1. Well, this is how Discord does. But I find it limitating not to be able to duplicate symbols, which is possible with 1. So 1. actually extends 3.

In a nutshell, I think 1. is the closest from what I‚Äôm requesting. The only snag I can think of is a race condition on the ordering of the symbol. E.g. If Bob is too slow, then it‚Äôs possible that Carl‚Äôs symbol slips between Bob‚Äôs and symbols so we end with ‚Äú ‚Äù instead. This is not a big deal IMO and Bob can easily fix this by removing their two symbols and re-enter them, so we end up with ‚Äú ‚Äù and each one‚Äôs intended order is restored.

Does this make it more clear? How much complicated GUI change would it imply?

[EDIT] Regarding the tag, I didn‚Äôt manage to remove the ‚ÄúAndroid Feature Requests‚Äù tag without also removing the ‚ÄúFeature Requests‚Äù tag, they seem tied to each other :(

posts.name: nett_hier
posts.cooked:
This is also useful for creating bot UIs, as explained in this, now closed, issue:

github.com/signalapp/Signal-Desktop

[Feature Request] Multiple reactions to one message

opened 07:59PM - 28 Oct 20 UTC
closed 10:30PM - 29 Sep 21 UTC
netthier
Feature Request

<!-- Please fill out this template with all the information you have. We can't ‚Ä¶do much without both the logs and a detailed description of what you've encountered. Please do your best! Please note that this tracker is only for bugs and feature requests. Please try these locations if you have a question or comment: https://community.signalusers.org/ http://support.signal.org/ support@signal.org Lastly, be sure to preview your issue before saving. Thanks! --> - [X] I have searched open and closed issues for duplicates <!-- You can search all issues here: https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Desktop/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue Replace [ ] with [X] once you've searched --> --- I'd like to request the ability to react with _multiple_ emojis to a message. I recently created a bot for my friend group, and I tried implementing menus the way they're common on Discord. However, I noticed that there's a limit of one reaction per user per message. Is this a deliberate design decision? Here's an example of how multiple reactions (by the bot) can be used to create interactive menus in Discord: ![](https://i.imgur.com/OSrlwbx.png)

(„Å§„ÄÄ Ôæâ „Åó„ÉºÔº™ ``` ## NEW!! Config option!! üéÆ‚ú® Added a toggie woggie in Settings > Chats!! - **OFF by default** = normal Signal behavior (one emoji per person) üò¥ - **Turn it ON** = MULTIPLE EMOJI PARTY MODE!! üéâüéä ``` Settings > Chats > "Allow multiple emoji reactions per message" ‚Üì [‚úì] Enable the chaos!! Ôºº(^o^)Ôºè ``` ## What I changey wangey'd: ‚ú® ### 1. Settings UI - Added the magic switch!! üîß ``` ts/components/Preferences.tsx <- checkbox UI!! ts/state/smart/Preferences.tsx <- state management!! _locales/en/messages.json <- "Allow multiple emoji reactions per message" ts/types/Storage.d.ts <- multipleEmojiReactions: boolean ``` Now there's a pretty checkbox that lets users CHOOSE their destiny!! Default OFF means no breaking existing behavior!! Safety first!! Ÿ©(‚óï‚Äø‚óï)€∂ ### 2. `util.ts` - Made reactions play nice together!! ``` BEFORE: fromId check only = (‚ïØ¬∞‚ñ°¬∞Ôºâ‚ïØÔ∏µ ‚îª‚îÅ‚îª AFTER: fromId + emoji check = ‚î¨‚îÄ‚î¨„Éé( ¬∫ _ ¬∫„Éé) ``` The meanie code was like "ONE EMOJI PER PERSON ONLY!!" but I made it check BOTH the person AND the emoji so now diffewent emojis can be fwends!! UwU BUT WAIT!! Now it checks the setting first!! If the toggle is OFF, it stays a meanie!! If ON, it becomes a softie!! (¬¥ÔΩ°‚Ä¢ ·µï ‚Ä¢ÔΩ°`) ### 3. `message.ts` - Stopped the Map bully!! ``` [Before] [After with setting ON] üòÄ <- only latest üòÄ üò¢ üéâ <- ALL THE EMOJIS!! per user :( Ôºº(^o^)Ôºè ``` The sewector was using a Map that was being a dictator keeping only the NEWEST reaction per person!! I made it CHECK THE SETTING!! If multipleEmojiReactions is ON, I YEET that Map into the void!! If OFF, the Map stays in charge like before!! Democracy wins!! üó≥Ô∏è‚ú® ### 4. `TimelineMessage.tsx` - Added toggie woggie magic!! ‚ö° ``` Click emoji already there = BYE BYE emoji! ‚îå( ‡≤†_‡≤†)‚îò Click new emoji = HELLO emoji! Ôºº(‚òÖ^‚àÄ^‚òÖ)Ôºè ``` Added code to check if u already weacted wiff that emoji using `reactions.some()` - if yes then REMOVE, if no then ADD!! It's like a light switch but for emojis!! xD ### 5. `Reactions.ts` - Fixed the undefined ouchie!! üíî‚Üí‚ù§Ô∏è ``` _____ / \ < "emoji was undefined for removes!!" | () () | \ > / ||||| *sad reaction noises* ``` The remove reactions had `emoji: reaction.remove ? undefined : reaction.emoji` which made the emoji DISAPPEAR when removing!! That's illegal!! Fixed to always keep the emoji so the filter can find it!! *starts twerking* ## The Magic Formula: ü™Ñ ``` OLD: reaction.fromId === newReaction.fromId ‚Üì (boring single emoji land) NEW: reaction.fromId === newReaction.fromId && reaction.emoji === newReaction.emoji ‚Üì (PARTY TIME MULTIPLE EMOJIS!!) ``` ## Testing stuffs: ‡∏Ö^‚Ä¢Ôªå‚Ä¢^‡∏Ö - Multiple emojis work!! Can add üòÄ AND üëç AND ‚ù§Ô∏è!! - Clicky same emoji = toggie off!! (¬¥ÔΩ°‚Ä¢ ·µï ‚Ä¢ÔΩ°`) - Old single reactions still work for backwards compatibility!! - No breaky wakey the reaction sync!! ‚ú® Can u pwease merge my pwull wequest senpai?!! This will make Signal Desktop kawaii AF!! *nuzzles your codebase* UwU ``` ‚àß_‚àß ( ÔΩ•œâÔΩ•) < "approve pls" ( „Å§Êó¶O „Å®Ôºø)_) ``` P.S. - Now with SETTINGS!! 6 files changed total!!
